segments.text: I can't believe my eyes, the sink is overflowing wildly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, but totally zoned out on her plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's cascading down like a waterfall in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's in it, and she doesn't even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now, that boy on the stoolâ€”it's leaning back alarmingly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's pulling cookies out like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is all excited, hand up for her turn.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They labeled the jar 'COOKIE JAR' so obviously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a serene garden, what a contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stacked neatly, but chaos brews nearby.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I never expected to see kids sneaking like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's steps look too small for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Everything seems so everyday, yet so off-kilter.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's amazing she hasn't heard the water splashing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene caught me completely off guard.
segments.speaker: PAR
